title: When pawprint meets footprint
summary: The first animal care product has been awarded the EU Ecolabel. Developed by Catalan manufacturer PROQUIMIA, the certified shampoo is a major step toward sustainable pet hygiene. Discover PROQUIMIA’s story and apply for the label to help ‘paw’ the way in sustainable pet care!

title: Celebrate 33 years of protecting the EU’s nature and join a Bioblitz near you
summary: European Natura 2000 Day is celebrated every year on 21 May. It marks the inception, 33 years ago, of a revolutionary approach to nature conservation in the EU – a large network of protected nature that maintains opportunities for economic and recreational development.

title: Commission adopts a user-friendly planning tool to support Member States in implementing the Nature Restoration Regulation
summary: The European Commission has adopted an Implementing Regulation that establishes a uniform format for national restoration plans under the Nature Restoration Regulation, which entered into force in August 2024.

title: Montenegro Joins the EU's LIFE Programme for Environment and Climate Action
summary: A cornerstone of the European Union's commitment to environmental protection and climate action, the LIFE programme offers Montenegro support to improve its environmental and climate policies and practices.

title: EU welcomes outcomes of Basel, Rotterdam and Stockholm Conventions COPs
summary: The recent outcomes of Basel, Rotterdam and Stockholm Conventions COPs mark a significant milestone in global efforts to address environmental challenges.

title: The EU Ecolabel keeps greening the absorbent hygiene products’ market
summary: Trust and transparency were the main keywords arising from the webinar “Caring for you, caring for the environment,” which spotlighted the benefits of the EU Ecolabel - the official EU ecolabel for product environmental excellence - in the absorbent hygiene sector.

title: Data visualisation tool inspired by land and property industry could support clean air policy in Europe’s cities
summary: Air quality is a priority in EU policy. A Polish study takes the concept of a cadastre – a structured database usually associated with land and property – and uses it to visualise emissions and clean air data, aiming to support city sustainability.

title: Call for evidence for the EU’s Strategic Foresight Report 2026
summary: The Commission would like your views to guide its Strategic Foresight Report 2026. The report asks: How can the European Union shape its long-term role in a rapidly changing and uncertain world?

title: Many charcoal barbecue products fall short of EU standards on composition and pollutant emissions
summary: EU standards regulate the composition of charcoal products sold for barbecues. A new study shows how the characteristics of charcoal affect emissions of key air pollutants during combustion, finding that lump charcoal burns more cleanly than briquettes.

title: How best to recycle Europe’s fast fashion waste? Grow mushrooms on it, say researchers
summary: With textile waste collection mandated across the EU, questions remain about what to do with all those materials. Latvian scientists explore several interesting solutions, including using waste textiles as a base for fungi-based thermal insulation.

title: VIDEO: How the EU is fighting environmental crime
summary: The latest episode of Euronews’ 'The Road to Green' explores how citizens, authorities and the EU are working to hold polluters accountable.

title: Commission launches consultation on marine protection rules
summary: New measures aim to further protect the marine environment, simplify its implementation and reduce administrative burden.

title: New law reducing microplastic pollution enters into force
summary: The new rules will help ensure fair competition across the Single Market and support Europe’s transition to a sustainable economy.

title: The future of the New European Bauhaus
summary: The Commission presented its plans for the future of the New European Bauhaus (NEB), adopted as part of the European Affordable Housing Plan.

title: UNEA-7 conclusion shows multilateralism still delivers
summary: The seventh United Nations Environment Assembly ended with decisions that will reinforce multilateral environmental agreements.

title: EU institutions reach agreement on end-of-life vehicles
summary: The deal on the Commission's proposed regulation covers the design, production and end-of-life treatment of vehicles.
